definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: PolyU Milestones is The Hong Kong Polytechnic University magazine published by the Communications and Public Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 是香港理工大学刊物，由传讯及公共事务处编印出版。

sentences.english: An indictment or information is presented to the court, and a formal arraignment on the charges is held.
sentences.chinese: 起诉方向法院提供起诉状，根据控诉正式传讯被告。

sentences.english: A prosecutor assigned to the courtroom handled most of the routine appearances and arraignments that were paraded through each day.
sentences.chinese: 一个公诉人一天会被分配到很多例行的开庭和传讯。

sentences.english: The tramp was arraigned on a charge of stealing.
sentences.chinese: 那流浪汉被指控有偷窃嫌疑而受到传讯。

sentences.english: Beckham was not cited or arrested.
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆未被传讯，也没有被逮捕。

sentences.english: He was awaiting arraignment last night.
sentences.chinese: 周三晚间他在等待传讯。

sentences.english: Kamil was arraigned in Los Angeles and charged with felony bank fraud.
sentences.chinese: 卡米尔在洛杉矶受到传讯，被指控犯有银行诈骗重罪。

sentences.english: Rumors amassed that portions of her brain had been subpoenaed for the analysis.
sentences.chinese: 有流言说他这个姐妹的部分脑组织被传讯拿来做分析。

sentences.english: Stephanie Cheung is a member of the Policy, Campaigns and Communications Unit of Oxfam Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 张亦敏为乐施会政策倡议及传讯部职员。

sentences.english: The finance director was subpoenaed by prosecution.
The finance director is subpoenaed by prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 财务经理被检查机关传讯。

sentences.english: Wyatt asks the desk clerk which courthouse he is being transferred to for arraignment.
sentences.chinese: 他向接待警员询问了马宏将在哪个法庭接受传讯。

sentences.english: She was remanded to juvenile detention at her arraignment yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 她昨天被送回了对少年拘留在她的传讯。

sentences.english: This is the second time that Matthew has been hauled up on a dangerous driving charge.
sentences.chinese: 这是马修第二次因危险行车而受到传讯。

sentences.english: I went outside to harvest andthat’s when I saw a messenger with torn clothes.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我去田里时，看到了一个破衣烂衫的传讯者。

definition: talisman in the form of a painting of symbols thought to have magical powers (also called 符籙|符箓[fu2 lu4])/to invoke the magical power of such a talisman/a tiger tally 虎符[hu3 fu2] sent with great urgency
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
(archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token
to send word/to deliver a letter
to investigate/to observe/to scout/to seek out and examine/to explore
to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
